GroupText: Spirometry (spy-ROM-uh-tree) is a common office test used to assess how well your lungs work by measuring how much air you inhale, how much you exhale and how quickly you exhale.
Spirometry is used to diagnose asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and other conditions that affect breathing.
A test consists of efforts which are individual maneuvers with the spirometer
A test requires between 3-5 efforts before enough data has been collected
During an effort, you should begin exhaling when prompted and you should exhale as hard as you can for as long as you can
An effort should conclude when you have expelled all the air from your lungs. This feeling should be relatively new and it may be slightly uncomfortable.
There are several issues that arise during spirometry efforts that invalidate the results and/or may cause discomfort:
- This is an issue with Spirometry
- This is another issue with Spirometry
- This is the final issue with Spirometry
